title: India vs Bangladesh, one-off Test, Day 5: Live Cricket Scores : Cricket, News - India Today
text:
Cricket India vs Bangladesh, one-off Test, Day 5: Live Cricket Scores It will be a huge task for Bangladesh to save the match as the tourists, chasing an improbable 459-run target, need another 356 runs for victory on the final day. IndiaToday.in | Posted by Subhasish Dutta A + A - BCCI Photo 
Hello and welcome to our Live coverage of the Day 5 of the one-off Test between India and Bangladesh in Hyderabad. Stay tuned as we bring you all the latest updates. ( LIVE SCORECARD ) 
Bangladesh 2nd innings: 
9.30 IST: The players and umpires are making their way out to the middle. If Bangladesh are to harbor any hopes of saving the game, they need a really strong first session. They need their senior men to get going in a big way to put up a fight. Mahmudullah is on strike for the first ball of the day. Virat Kohli not wasting any time and starting the day with spin. Ravindra Jadeja to bowl the first over of the day. 
9.25 IST: Pitch Report - Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said cracks haven't spread yet and that it was still a really good batting wicket as the cracks are mainly visible on the fuller lengths. He opined that Bangladesh have two batsmen in the middle and two more to come as they look to survive the whole day. 
9.15 IST: Here's what the pitch looks like today. India are seven wickets away from a win and this is what the pitch looks like ahead of the final day's play. #INDvBAN pic.twitter.com/nKxxvomHa5 â€” BCCI (@BCCI) February 13, 2017 
9.00 IST: The pitch has started to turn and that will benefit the Indian spinners. On the other hand, Bangladesh will want to seal off a sensational draw as a victory seems far away. AP Photo 
8.45 IST: It should be an exciting day of cricket as the hosts are in site of victory. They have dominated for the most parts of this test match but the visitors have also shown resistance while batting. They would once again like to put a good challenge today. 
8.35 IST: It will be a huge task for Bangladesh today to save this game although not impossible. Morning session will be vital for the tourists. Chasing an improbable 459-run target, Bangladesh need another 356 runs for victory. This is the first time Bangladesh have taken a Test vs India in to the fifth day without any assistance from weather / rain. #IndvBan â€” Rajneesh Gupta (@rgcricket) February 12, 2017 Brief Day 4 Report: Bangladesh reached 103/3 in 35 overs at stumps on day four of the one-off test against India in Hyderabad on Sunday.
The tourists, chasing an improbable 459-run target, need another 356 runs for victory. 
Bangladesh was bowled out for 388 in their first innings, prompting India to declare at 159/4 in their second innings to set up the chase. 
At stumps, Shakib Al Hasan was unbeaten on 21 runs, while Mahmudullah was batting on 9 not out. ( Read Full Report Here ) For more news from India Today, follow us on Twitter @indiatoday and on Facebook at facebook.com/IndiaToday For news and videos in Hindi, go to AajTak.in . ताज़ातरीन ख़बरों और वीडियो के लिए आजतक.इन पर आएं.
